attributes.action: instruct the judiciary to treat EVERYONE found guilty of a driving offence in the same way.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
What I particularly have in mind is the frequent - far too frequent - situation in which someone, often a celebrity, is spared a driving ban on the grounds that the driver needs his/her car to fulfil various obligations or to do his/her job; this in spite of being found guilty of speeding or some other offence which could have killed or injured an innocent road user or pedestrian.  My feeling is: "tough! if it's so important to have the use of your car don't commit the offence!".  

I also completely fail to understand why an individual in this situation can't be told to employ a driver or take taxis!  Why should they effectively get away with breaking the law just because they need to be able to use their car?
